Attribute.AttributeName: System.Obsolete("The System.Web.Mobile.dll assembly has been deprecated and should no longer be used. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=157231.")

Docs.summary: Provides control capability to display a calendar. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The calendar display is by day, week, or month. Whether an entire month is rendered on a mobile device depends on the capabilities of the device. In general, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control permits the selection of a date.
The mobile <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control wraps a Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control. Although the mobile <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control mimics some properties, methods, and events of the underlying control, it does not expose other properties specific to HTML rendering. To modify these, you can access the underlying control through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.WebCalendar%2A> property and modify the settings directly.
## Examples The following code example shows how the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> property in the page load code block allows the user to select a day, a week, or a month block of time. This example sets the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BorderStyle%2A> and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebControl.BackColor%2A> properties of the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> class to distinguish the user selection.
> [!NOTE] > The following code sample uses the single-file code model and may not work correctly if copied directly into a code-behind file. This code sample must be copied into an empty text file that has an .aspx extension. For more information, see [ASP.NET Web Forms Page Code Model](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/81b13e7a-b95b-4285-906f-d2dd77411417).

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the day of the week to display in the first column of a calendar. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The day of the week displayed in the first column of a calendar. The default value is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks In the ASP.NET API, the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.FirstDayOfWeek%2A> enumeration contains every day of the week, with the default value returning the server's local setting for the first day of the week.
This property functions the same way as the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.FirstDayOfWeek%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig newslot virtual instance void OnSelectionChanged() cil managed
abstract member OnSelectionChanged : unit -> unit override this.OnSelectionChanged : unit -> unit

Docs.summary: Raises the event. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionChanged> event is raised when the user selects a day, a week, or an entire month by clicking the date selector controls.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method also allows derived classes to handle the event without attaching a delegate. This is the preferred technique for handling the event in a derived class.
> [!NOTE] > When overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method in a derived class, be sure to call the base class's <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method so that registered delegates receive the event.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is used primarily by custom control developers.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig instance void RaiseSelectionChangedEvent() cil managed

Docs.summary: Called to raise an event indicating that the selection changed. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format: ## Remarks This method is called internally by ASP.NET. It provides a wrapper to raise the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionChanged> event when a date is selected by the user. Unlike the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.OnSelectionChanged%2A> method, this method is public and can be called by different adapters when they have collected the selected date.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property DateTime SelectedDate { DateTime get(); void set(DateTime value); };
member this.SelectedDate : DateTime with get, set

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the currently selected date. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The currently selected date. The default value is the value of .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Typically, you use this property together with the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> property to determine the selected date of a <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control. To do this, set the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectionMode%2A> property to <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode.Day> - this setting allows only a single date selection from the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.
Browsing to the next or previous month will not update this property.
This property has the same functionality as the ASP.NET <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to the use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.SelectedDate%2A> property to refer to the selected day. This example is part of a larger code sample for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> overview.

MemberSignature.Value: public: property System::Web::UI::WebControls::CalendarSelectionMode SelectionMode { System::Web::UI::WebControls::CalendarSelectionMode get(); void set(System::Web::UI::WebControls::CalendarSelectionMode value); };

Docs.summary: Gets or sets the selection mode of a object. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The selection mode of the calendar control. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode> enumeration provides the selections described in the following table.
|Value|Description| |-----------|-----------------| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode.Day>|A single date can be selected on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode.DayWeek>|A single date or entire week can be selected on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode.DayWeekMonth>|A single date, week, or entire month can be selected on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control.| |<xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.CalendarSelectionMode.None>|No dates can be selected on the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> control. **Note:** Avoid using this value, because some browsers still allow the user to select a date.|

Docs.exception: The specified value is not one of the values.

Docs.summary: Gets or sets a date that specifies the month to display. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.
Docs.value: The date that specifies the month to display. The default is .

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.VisibleDate%2A> property is updated after the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleMonthChanged?displayProperty=nameWithType> event is raised.
The date can be any day within the month. Only the month value of the <xref:System.DateTime> object is used.
This property has the same functionality as the Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar.VisibleDate%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.VisibleDate%2A> property to set the visible dates on the calendar. This example is part of a larger code sample for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> overview.

MemberSignature.Value: Public ReadOnly Property WebCalendar As Calendar
public: property System::Web::UI::WebControls::Calendar ^ WebCalendar { System::Web::UI::WebControls::Calendar ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the underlying Web Forms control. This API is obsolete. For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see Mobile Apps & Sites with ASP.NET.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The ASP.NET mobile controls do not duplicate the properties of the ASP.NET Web Forms <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control that are not supported on mobile devices. Thus, if you want to use features that are available for the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar> control, you do so by accessing the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar?displayProperty=nameWithType> object through the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.WebCalendar%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example uses the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar.WebCalendar%2A> property to apply formatting that is only available in the underlying <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.Calendar?displayProperty=nameWithType> control. This example is part of a larger code sample for the <xref:System.Web.UI.MobileControls.Calendar> overview.
[!code-csharp[MobileCalendarExample#10](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileCalendarExample/cs/MobileCalendarExample.aspx#10)] [!code-vb[MobileCalendarExample#10](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_WebNet/MobileCalendarExample/vb/MobileCalendarExample.aspx#10)]
